answerFeedback.c7cf7532-2f65-4368-a1e4-d021a80dffa5: Correct because additionally, operating activities include cash receipts and payments related to dealing securities or trading securities (as opposed to buying or selling securities as investments, as discussed below). In addition, the purchase and sale of securities held for dealing or trading purposes are considered operating activities even for companies where this is not a primary business activity.
answerFeedback.d8ddbfcf-91fb-4539-a65e-333c8d4fa3ee: Incorrect because financing activities include cash payments to repurchase stock (e.g., treasury stock).

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2023.01-CorpIssuers-Mazararu-14
entry.itemBody: Which pricing model combines multiple products so that customers are incentivized to buy them together?

answerFeedback.46052878-c20e-48d7-ab3c-f4aac9bb5feb: Incorrect because value-based pricing means setting prices based on the value received by the customer, which often involves estimating opportunity cost.
answerFeedback.51d8aa81-f8a4-40c3-a9e9-e8f11c6850ce: Incorrect because tiered pricing involves charging different prices to different buyers, often based on volume purchased but also based on product features (e.g., base versus premium trims of vehicles).
answerFeedback.a1b9b0a6-e8b4-40ae-bc70-a4eaf16d5616: Correct because bundling refers to combining multiple products or services so that customers are incentivized or required to buy them together. Bundling can be effective, particularly for products that are complementary and that have high incremental profit margins and high marketing costs relative to the cost of the product itself.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-L1-2020B-CorpFin-Su-03
entry.itemBody: Which of the following strategies is least likely to be used by shareholder activists?

answerFeedback.260fa351-d5f5-4d37-a7bd-95bf1dde2d02: Correct because anti-takeover measures, such as. a shareholder rights plan (also known as a poison pill), reduces the likelihood of an unwanted takeover. Shareholder rights plans enable shareholders to buy additional shares at a discount if another shareholder purchases a certain percentage of the company’s shares. These plans are designed to increase the cost to any bidder seeking to take over a company. This is not a strategy used by shareholder activists but by management.
answerFeedback.5d2a60be-8d20-470f-bbb0-1b218ba88c2c: Incorrect because shareholder activists may pursue additional tactics, such as shareholder derivative lawsuits, which are legal proceedings initiated by one or more shareholders against board directors, management, and/or controlling shareholders of the company.
answerFeedback.b9e478a2-6aa9-4584-88ac-aa959ed90a75: Incorrect because activist shareholders often pressure management through such tactics as initiating proxy battles (fights), proposing shareholder resolutions, and publicly raising awareness on issues of contention.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2021.05-Econ-Coorey-02
entry.itemBody: A well-defined supply function is most likely available to:

answerFeedback.4e3c43b5-c25c-48b9-b516-f3d32c9fa206: Incorrect because in perfect competition, the firm’s supply schedule is represented by the marginal cost schedule. In monopolistic competition, there is no well-defined supply function.
answerFeedback.d24e1a41-deff-429e-baaf-56ffb6a017df: Correct because in perfect competition, the firm’s supply schedule is represented by the marginal cost schedule.
answerFeedback.eaa2bff5-cc77-43cd-a95c-5032b5cc89a4: Incorrect because as in the market structures of monopolistic competition and oligopoly, the monopolist does not have a well-defined supply function that determines the optimal output level and the price to charge.

choices.itemBody: B. a firm operating in perfect competition.
C. a firm operating in monopolistic competition.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2021.03-CorpIssuers-Tyler-15
entry.itemBody:
An analyst gathers the following information about three companies in the same industry but at different stages of their life cycles:

  Year 1 Revenue (in $ Millions) Year 2 Revenue (in $ Millions) Year 3 Revenue (in $ Millions) Year 3 Debt/Capital
Company 1 10 11   9 0%
Company 2 30 36 44 8%
Company 3 100 95 97 25%

Based only on this information, the company with the greatest capacity to absorb additional leverage in Year 4 is most likely:

answerFeedback.49bde14b-4bb1-4e3f-a18d-270ff9f98dc9: Incorrect because with negligible revenue growth and Debt/Capital already greater than 25%, this company is most likely a mature company. Mature companies usually use leverage, but a Debt/Capital ratio of 25% means less ability to increase leverage than a company in its growth phase with less debt outstanding.
answerFeedback.abe1e9c8-8c12-4be1-9a33-d2306bd631fe: Incorrect because with volatile revenue growth from a low base and no debt, this is most likely a company in its start-up phase. At this early stage, debt capital is typically not available.
answerFeedback.f6d83abe-0147-4b54-9be5-06a8d73932b9: Correct because since the company's revenue is growing steadily (20% in the first year and 22% subsequently) and there is already a small amount of debt in the capital structure, this company is most likely in its growth phase. A company in this phase with less than 10% Debt/Capital likely has the capacity to increase debt.

entry.title: ITEM_2019B Econ 13DXH
entry.itemBody:
An analyst gathers the following exchange rate information:

USD/EUR spot rate 1.0351
1-week USD/EUR forward points –1.1

USD/EUR is the amount of USD per 1 EUR

The 1-week USD/EUR forward rate is closest to:

answerFeedback.0791f425-ea82-4f05-b031-6f4285a6c046: Incorrect because the one-week forward rate is incorrectly calculated by dividing the forward points by 1,000: 1.0351 + ( ̶ 1.1)/1,000 = 1.03400.
answerFeedback.1db6f349-9cb6-4cd8-86df-c219af83f5cb: Incorrect because the one-week forward rate is incorrectly calculated by dividing the forward points by 100: 1.0351 + ( ̶ 1.1)/100 = 1.02410.
answerFeedback.de6aaea3-3eda-40e6-b3c7-87548a924ee4: Correct because to convert any of the quoted forward points into a forward rate, one would divide the number of points by 10,000 (to scale down to the fourth decimal place, the last decimal place in the spot quote) and then add the result to the spot exchange rate quote. In this case the one-week forward rate is calculated as 1.0351 + ( ̶ 1.1)/10,000 = 1.03499.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-L1-2020B-Econ-McDonald-09
entry.itemBody: A sign of expansionary fiscal policy is a(n):

answerFeedback.1ef93cd8-c506-4a06-a7c9-317c55b92c4d: Incorrect because an increase in indirect taxes would be contractionary not expansionary. An expansionary policy could take one or more of the following forms cuts in sales (indirect) taxes to lower prices which raises real incomes with the objective of raising consumer demand.
answerFeedback.4bfac731-e301-420b-bfcc-450540182ec9: Incorrect because reserve requirements are an instrument of monetary policy not fiscal policy. The third primary way in which central banks can limit or increase the supply of money in an economy is via their reserve requirements.
answerFeedback.ed54913e-e68f-43d4-a199-d8f5c4277773: Correct because an increase in a budget surplus would be associated with contractionary fiscal policy, while a rise in a deficit is an expansionary fiscal policy.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2021.03-Quant-Glover-01
entry.itemBody:
An investor requiring $10,000 in ten years' time has $7,500 to invest today and has access to the following two accounts:

  Stated Annual Interest Rate Compounding Frequency
Account 1 3.0% Quarterly
Account 2 2.9% Daily

Which of the accounts will allow the investor to achieve their goal?

answerFeedback.7c31f082-4ed1-4e1c-a67e-ab2b9f2972d8: Incorrect because Account 1 also allows the investor to meet their goal. With more than one compounding period per year, the future value formula can be expressed as FVN = PV[1 + (rs/m)]mN where rs is the stated annual interest rate, m is the number of compounding periods per year, and N now stands for the number of years. Hence for Account 1, FV10 = $7,500 × [1 + (0.03/4)]4×10 = $10,113 which is greater than the required goal.
answerFeedback.89758606-032b-41ce-b0a8-5d0be385cda2: Correct because with more than one compounding period per year, the future value formula can be expressed as FVN = PV[1 + (rs/m)]mN where rs is the stated annual interest rate, m is the number of compounding periods per year, and N now stands for the number of years. Identifying N = 10 and PV = $7,500, we have for Account 1 (with m = 4): FV10 = $7,500 × [1 + (0.03/4)]4×10 = $10,113 and for Account 2 (with m = 365): FV10 = $7,500 × [1 + (0.029/365)]365×10 = $10,023. Hence, both accounts will have a balance above $10,000 in 10 years' time.
answerFeedback.c8a533e3-a1f1-4c9b-a71b-662f5b2235a5: Incorrect because Account 2 also allows the investor to meet their goal. With more than one compounding period per year, the future value formula can be expressed as FVN = PV[1 + (rs/m)]mN where rs is the stated annual interest rate, m is the number of compounding periods per year, and N now stands for the number of years. Hence for Account 2, FV10 = $7,500 × [1 + (0.029/365)]365×10 = $10,023 which is greater than the required goal.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2021.09-PM-Tomter-09
entry.itemBody: Which of the following areas is most likely to apply natural language processing?

answerFeedback.0c7c1555-4bef-4879-b17c-124ab1921736: Incorrect because data encryption uses cryptography, not natural language processing. Features of DLT (distributed ledger technology) include the use of cryptography—an algorithmic process to encrypt data, making the data unusable if received by unauthorized parties—which enables a high level of network security and database integrity. For example, DLT uses cryptographic methods of proof to verify network participant identity and for data encryption.
answerFeedback.0d236a71-8fdb-4f77-bbda-b4b6c0e8f17f: Correct because NLP (natural language processing) may also be employed in compliance functions to review employee voice and electronic communications for adherence to company or regulatory policy, inappropriate conduct, or fraud or for ensuring private or customer information is kept confidential. Text analytics involves the use of computer programs to analyze and derive meaning typically from large, unstructured text- or voice-based datasets, and within the larger field of text analytics, NLP is an important application.
answerFeedback.224f7149-693d-4447-83fa-da4a62cdc085: Incorrect because natural language processing is applied to unstructured data, not structured data. Structured data items can be organized in tables and are commonly stored in a database where each field represents the same type of information.

entry.title: ITEM_20170421159
entry.itemBody: The following 10 observations are a sample drawn from a normal population: 25, 20, 18, −5, 35, 21, −11, 8, 20, and 9. The mean of the sample is closest to:

answerFeedback.3cbe60cb-eedc-4def-8977-95b536a424c3: Incorrect. It is calculated by dividing 140 by 9 (i.e., by n − 1 rather than n).
answerFeedback.87c30cae-d0ee-4809-8bd9-bcae5a0c6759: Incorrect. It is calculated by adding the absolute values of the ten numbers (i.e., −11 is valued as 11 and −5 is valued as 5).
answerFeedback.adefee83-3d6b-4f1c-a35d-3c58208d814e: Correct. The sum of the 10 numbers is 140. Dividing by 10 gives the mean of 14.

entry.title: ITEM_20170421004
entry.itemBody: The arithmetic and geometric mean are calculated for the same data. If there is variability in the data, compared with the arithmetic mean, the geometric mean will most likely be:

answerFeedback.6e8df700-8148-4340-9222-e6cd69fb48c9: Incorrect. The geometric mean is typically less than the arithmetic mean.
answerFeedback.c01b9926-a735-440b-b966-90640c86582f: Correct. The geometric mean is always less than or equal to the arithmetic mean. The only time the two means will be equal is when there is no variability in the observations.
answerFeedback.c919d8fe-b59f-4718-a16d-32e5256bb0a1: Incorrect. The geometric mean is typically less than the arithmetic mean.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2021.03-CorpIssuers-Kashyap-17
entry.itemBody: A company's interest payments are fully tax deductible. When tax rates increase, the company's cost of debt:

answerFeedback.9bf04677-9aec-4faf-9111-e9c74269251d: Incorrect because the cost of debt would decrease, not increase. The marginal cost of debt financing is the cost of debt after considering the allowable deduction for interest on debt based on the country’s tax law. The marginal cost of debt is rd(1 – t).
answerFeedback.c2fd7bd8-ecdd-4456-8ee4-08e40a2da66e: Incorrect because when interest is deductible, the marginal cost of debt is equal to rd (1 – t). If tax rates increase, the cost of debt will decrease, not remain the same.
answerFeedback.edec0ee3-dfed-452d-a4bd-2f8ba43da6ac: Correct because the marginal cost of debt financing is the cost of debt after considering the allowable deduction for interest on debt. Based on the country’s tax law the marginal cost of debt is rd(1 – t). Therefore, if tax rates increase the after-tax cost of debt will decrease.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2022.06-FSAN-Huffman-06
entry.itemBody: If a company's receivables turnover ratio is equal to its payables turnover ratio, the company's cash conversion cycle is equal to its number of days of:

answerFeedback.0b28fe48-fbfe-4e9c-8833-c36624c15c5e: Correct because a company with the same value for receivables turnover and payables turnover has the same number of days sales outstanding (DSO) as the number of days of payables; therefore, the company's cash conversion cycle would equal the days of inventory on hand (DOH). That is, as a company's cash conversion cycle is equal to DOH + DSO – Number of days of payables when a company's DSO is equal to the number of days of payables, the company's cash conversion cycle is equal to its DOH.
answerFeedback.120e26c1-eec1-48cf-9526-d02db539014c: Incorrect because when a company's DSO is equal to the number of days of payables the company's cash conversion cycle is equal to its DOH. A company's cash conversion cycle is equal to DOH + DSO – Number of days of payables. The company's DSO is equal to the number of days of payables because the receivables turnover and the payables turnover ratios have the same value.
answerFeedback.be9a44fc-4b1e-4878-9cd9-7cece5d861d0: Incorrect because when a company's DSO is equal to the number of days of payables the company's cash conversion cycle is equal to its DOH. A company's cash conversion cycle is equal to DOH + DSO – Number of days of payables. The company's DSO is equal to the number of days of payables because the receivables turnover and the payables turnover ratios have the same value.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2021.07-Econ-Islam-18
entry.itemBody: In a fixed parity currency regime, excess private demand for the domestic currency:

answerFeedback.22edbdd2-d2be-4c77-8bc5-983d182de27d: Incorrect because in a fixed parity currency regime excess private demand for the domestic currency implies a rapidly growing stock of foreign exchange reserves.
answerFeedback.44d0abe5-620f-4491-81b6-0093ed8d959b: Incorrect because in a fixed parity currency regime excess private demand for the domestic currency implies a rapidly growing stock of foreign exchange reserves. Deficient demand for the currency depletes foreign exchange reserves and exerts deflationary pressure on the economy.
answerFeedback.509704ac-506a-40e6-bbc1-04e0f579abd1: Correct because in a fixed parity currency regime excess private demand for the domestic currency implies a rapidly growing stock of foreign exchange reserves, expansion of the domestic money supply, and potentially accelerating inflation.

choices.itemBody: A. implies a depleting stock of foreign exchange reserves.
B. makes no implication about the country's foreign exchange reserves.
C. implies a growing stock of foreign exchange reserves.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-L1-03811
entry.itemBody: In a period of rising prices and stable inventory quantities, the value of ending inventory will most closely reflect current replacement value under which of the following inventory valuation methods?

answerFeedback.541f5d45-dde4-4148-aa70-ccc40d6dbecb: Incorrect because under LIFO, the oldest goods purchased remain in ending inventory. The value of ending inventory reflects the cost of older goods. Because prices are changing and the value of ending inventory reflects the cost of older goods, it is not the best reflection of current replacement value.
answerFeedback.6d8ce304-9481-4565-85b9-f5428354778e: Correct because the value of ending inventory under FIFO reflects the costs of goods purchased more recently. Because the ending inventory reflects the cost of goods purchased more recently, it will better reflect current replacement value.
answerFeedback.c6fd686d-8a83-4756-8cbb-357b621105e5: Incorrect because the weighted average cost method assigns the average cost of the goods available for sale during the accounting period to the units sold as well as to the units in ending inventory. The value of ending inventory under the weighted average cost method will more closely reflect current replacement value than the LIFO method, but not as closely as the FIFO method.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-L1-2020-C2-Econ-Milosevic-11
entry.itemBody:
An analyst gathers the following exchange rate information:

  Spot rate Forward rate
AUD/USD 1.3889 1.3195
AUD/EUR 1.6393 1.4875

AUD/USD is the amount of AUD per 1 USD

AUD/EUR is the amount of AUD per 1 EUR

The USD is expected to depreciate against:

answerFeedback.2614b26b-62f3-461c-b1ee-b98be2187fa4: Incorrect because the AUD/USD is expected to decline from 1.3889 to 1.3195, and therefore the AUD will appreciate against USD, and by definition the USD will depreciate against the AUD. The USD/EUR cross-rate is calculated as: 1/(AUD/USD) × (AUD/EUR). Therefore, the spot cross rate: USD/EUR = 1/(1.3889) × 1.6393 = 1.1803; and the forward cross-rate: USD/EUR = (1/1.3195) × 1.4875 = 1.1273. Therefore the USD will appreciate against the EUR.
answerFeedback.285ab384-4f9b-45c4-944f-c507d89ddc58: Correct because the AUD/USD is expected to decline from 1.3889 to 1.3195, and therefore the AUD will appreciate against USD, and by definition the USD will depreciate against the AUD. The USD/EUR cross-rate is calculated as: 1/(AUD/USD) × (AUD/EUR). Therefore, the spot cross rate: USD/EUR = 1/(1.3889) × 1.6393 = 1.1803; and the forward cross-rate: USD/EUR = (1/1.3195) × 1.4875 = 1.1273. Therefore the USD will appreciate against the EUR.
answerFeedback.a4ef3c58-d5de-4a3a-8561-24313d64a688: Incorrect because the AUD/USD is expected to decline from 1.3889 to 1.3195, and therefore the AUD will appreciate against USD, and by definition the USD will depreciate against the AUD. The USD/EUR cross-rate is calculated as: 1/(AUD/USD) × (AUD/EUR). Therefore, the spot cross rate: USD/EUR = 1/(1.3889) × 1.6393 = 1.1803; and the forward cross-rate: USD/EUR = (1/1.3195) × 1.4875 = 1.1273. Therefore the USD will appreciate against the EUR.

choices.itemBody: C. both the AUD and the EUR.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-L1-10881
entry.itemBody: All else being equal, an increase in the central bank's policy rate most likely puts downward pressure on domestic inflation by:

answerFeedback.3472b843-5593-431e-8be0-61ebad8ca629: Incorrect because market participants would then come to the view that higher interest rates will lead to slower economic growth, reduced profits, and reduced borrowing to finance asset purchases. The fall in asset prices as well as an increase in prices would reduce household financial wealth and therefore lead to a reduction in consumption growth.
answerFeedback.bb427fd9-c3a8-4330-8b2b-db37a088dbf1: Incorrect because a rise in the central bank's policy rate is likely to weaken investors' confidence. Market participants would then come to the view that higher interest rates will lead to slower economic growth, reduced profits, and reduced borrowing to finance asset purchases.
answerFeedback.da6862ff-c396-4c45-9255-205650261bb3: Correct because there is a whole range of interconnected ways in which a rise in the central bank's policy rate can reduce real domestic demand and net external demand (that is, the difference between export and import consumption). Weaker total demand would tend to put downward pressure on the rate of domestic inflation—as would a stronger currency, which would reduce the prices of imports. Taken together, these might begin to put downward pressure on the overall measure of inflation.

entry.title: ITEM_20170608122
entry.itemBody: An analyst is reviewing the property, plant, and equipment disclosure related to a company’s warehouse. Under the revaluation model, the analyst would least likely be able to determine:

answerFeedback.003dcc0c-d699-4214-a8e3-1b33e25841b5: Correct because IFRS does not require disclosure of the original date of acquisition.
answerFeedback.072c2c2f-088f-4f3b-b2b5-3184cb063dee: Incorrect because the details of how fair value was obtained must be disclosed by companies using the revaluation model.
answerFeedback.85bc0fc3-415f-44ee-a882-7a650f7c633d: Incorrect because under the cost model, the carrying amount must be disclosed by companies using the revaluation model.

choices.itemBody: B. how the fair value was obtained.
C. the carrying amount under the cost model.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-L1-2020-C2-Econ-Zipp-06
entry.itemBody: A crucial requirement for a central bank to be effective is to:

answerFeedback.aa0bd6da-3fe8-4d14-9202-bb7a1122a670: Incorrect because independence, credibility, and transparency are arguably the crucial ingredients for an effective central bank, whether they target inflation or not. Thus, maintaining reasonable inflation targets (or even targeting inflation) is not a crucial requirement for a central bank to be considered effective.
answerFeedback.cf1de142-3c5b-47e8-8030-cf6799be6ff5: Correct because independence, credibility, and transparency are arguably the crucial ingredients for an effective central bank, whether they target inflation or not.
answerFeedback.e3a9469b-5104-40f2-8d66-e2091ce5b9c0: Incorrect because independence, credibility, and transparency are arguably the crucial ingredients for an effective central bank, whether they target inflation or not. Additionally, one way of establishing credibility is for a central bank to be transparent in its decision making.  By explaining their views on the economy and by being transparent in decision making, the independent, inflation-targeting central banks seek to gain reputation and credibility, making it easier to influence inflation expectations and hence ultimately easier to meet the inflation target. Thus, preserving the confidentiality of its economic views contradicts a crucial ingredient of transparency.

choices.itemBody: C. preserve the confidentiality of its economic views.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2021.03-CorpIssuers-Su-03
entry.itemBody: In ESG factor analysis, a company's ownership of stranded assets is most likely considered a(n):

answerFeedback.07a697be-ca4d-4cea-b9b4-a5a26d9e0d3f: Correct because environmental factors that are generally considered material in investment analysis include the existence of carbon assets. Stranded assets are carbon-intensive assets at risk of no longer being economically viable because of changes in regulation or investor sentiment.
answerFeedback.2c4b911a-6e87-4df0-b857-b5f5a567a8ad: Incorrect because stranded assets are an environmental risk, not a social risk. Social factors considered in ESG implementation generally pertain to the management of the human capital of a business.
answerFeedback.7049f211-d211-429d-9722-4df4b749fd7c: Incorrect because the existence of "stranded assets" is more likely related to environmental risk, not a governance risk. Corporate governance can be defined as the system of internal controls and procedures by which individual companies are managed.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-L1-2020A-FRA-Mazararu-17
entry.itemBody: A company's cash contribution to its defined contribution pension plan is recorded on the company's statement of cash flows as a(n):

answerFeedback.1838ea30-67f2-4487-9cef-541fb32508c2: Incorrect because the amount the company contributes to the plan is treated as an operating cash outflow, not a financing cash outflow.
answerFeedback.89b59f28-e710-4801-ba18-8e4d4763e103: Correct because under a defined-contribution plan, a company contributes an agreed-upon (defined) amount into the plan. The agreed-upon amount is the pension expense. The amount the company contributes to the plan is treated as an operating cash outflow.
answerFeedback.ee02816c-e61a-4d97-ad44-f41ba18066d2: Incorrect because the amount the company contributes to the plan is treated as an operating cash outflow, not an investing cash outflow.

entry.title: ITEM_20170608335
entry.itemBody:
An analyst gathers the following common-size income statements for three companies in the same industry.
  Company X Company Y Company Z
Revenue 100% 100% 100%
Cost of goods sold 65 50 30
Administrative expenses 20 20 20
Research and development 0 5 30
Advertising expenses 5 15 10
Operating profit 10 10 10

Based on this information, which company is most likely to have a technically superior product?

answerFeedback.3a48803e-47e3-4e68-80cf-4a69009d9e5c: Correct because Company Z spent the most on research and development and is able to support the highest gross margin (lowest cost of goods sold). It likely has the technically superior product.
answerFeedback.87550253-b13f-42d3-bcd6-2f2c521b6b03: Incorrect because Company Y spends significantly less than Company Z on research and development. It is unlikely to have a technically superior product.
answerFeedback.cb5674ee-c9f8-4dc9-866a-5addb15cae60: Incorrect because Company X spends nothing on research and development. It is unlikely to have a technically superior product.

entry.title: ITEM_2019B FRA 06PWN
entry.itemBody:
An analyst gathers the following information about a company’s fiscal year beginning on 1 January:

Net income £1,800,000
Preferred dividends declared and paid £600,000
Common shares outstanding on 31 December 300,000
Weighted average common shares outstanding during the year 500,000
Convertible preferred shares outstanding during the year 25,000

If one preferred share can be converted into four common shares and there are no other potentially dilutive securities outstanding, reported diluted EPS should be:

answerFeedback.2a4e5721-93de-44f9-8827-2e185809f5ab: Incorrect because it does not consider that the convertible preferred stock is antidilutive and the reported dilutive EPS equals to calculated diluted EPS of £3.00.
answerFeedback.303aab76-47fa-40f6-8d5e-d77e1fb21b0e:
Incorrect because it uses the number of shares outstanding at year-end, not weighted average during the year in the formula for diluted EPS and basic EPS.

Diluted EPS = Net income / (Number of common shares outstanding at year-end + New common shares that would have been issued at conversion);

or

Diluted EPS = £ 1,800,000 [ 300,000 + ( 25,000 × 4 ) ] = £ 1,800,000 400,000 = £ 4.50

Basic EPS = (Net income – Preferred dividends)/ Number of common shares outstanding at year-end;

or

Basic EPS = £ 1,800,000 − £ 600,000 300,000 = £ 1,200,000 / 300,000 = £ 4.00

As Basic EPS of £4.00 is lower than the diluted EPS of £4.50, the convertible preferred stock is antidilutive, the reported dilutive EPS should thus be equal to basic EPS of £4.00.
answerFeedback.d480a5fc-19a3-4007-acc0-d981a91be7e5:
Correct because reported diluted EPS is equal to basic EPS as the convertible security is antidilutive (i.e. their inclusion would result in an EPS higher than the company’s basic EPS). Under IFRS and US GAAP, antidilutive securities are not included in the calculation of reported diluted EPS. Reported diluted EPS will always be less than or equal to basic EPS. Reported diluted EPS is calculated using the if-converted method. The if-converted method is based on what EPS would have been if the convertible preferred securities had been converted at the beginning of the period.

Diluted EPS using the if-converted method for preferred stock is Net income/ (Weighted average number of shares outstanding + New common shares that would have been issued at conversion); or = £1,800,000 / [500,000 + (25,000 × 4)] = £1,800,000 / 600,000 = £3.00. Basic EPS = (Net income – Preferred dividends)/ Weighted average number of shares outstanding = (£1,800,000 – £600,000) / 500,000 = £1,200,000 / 500,000 = £2.40.

As Basic EPS of £2.40 is lower than the diluted EPS of £3.00, the convertible preferred stock is antidilutive, the reported dilutive EPS should thus be equal to basic EPS of £2.40.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2022.01-CorpIssuers-Tsependa-15
entry.itemBody: Which of the following best represents the potential for misaligned interests between shareholders and board directors when director tenures are excessively long?

answerFeedback.3b973d00-9051-4cb8-a78e-d36a8d8bcdac: Incorrect because excessive risk taking stems from a compensation package relying too heavily on stock grants and options (not an excessive fixed pay) which can motivate risk-taking behavior by management, since option holders participate only in upside share price moves. Similarly, too little or no use of stock grants and options awarded to managers can lead to the opposite result. This misalignment may be at odds with the company’s value creation objective or with shareholder’s desire for higher-risk, higher-reward endeavors.
answerFeedback.76271842-124b-42a8-973d-29de623fd5bb: Correct because if we consider the typical elements of management compensation, we can identify common examples of misalignment or conflicts including entrenchment. When the overall level of board director or manager compensation, or tenure, is excessive, the result may lead to the avoidance of risk motivated by a vested interest in keeping one’s position. In such a scenario, directors may avoid speaking out against management in the interest of shareholders or other stakeholders.
answerFeedback.9fef2d65-6ba2-4760-8695-30eb44dfd6dc: Incorrect because empire building refers to situations when director and management compensation are high and tied to the size of the business, it can also lead to 'growth for growth’s sake' in which managers are motivated to pursue acquisitions and expansion that might not increase shareholder value.

entry.title: ITEM_20180516125
entry.itemBody: Accounts payable are:

answerFeedback.2b3f7942-4509-4e48-9ce3-083c965474af: Correct because accounts payable are amounts that a company owes its vendors for purchases of goods and services. They represent the unpaid amount as of the balance sheet date of the company’s purchases on credit.
answerFeedback.8954e549-5ce1-4f08-98e3-62e7607011f4: Incorrect because accounts payable and notes payable due in one year both are current liabilities, which are reported in the current liability section of the balance sheet.
answerFeedback.8dcd6249-d915-4bff-9aea-99c64d2090dc: Incorrect because notes payable (not accounts payable) are financial liabilities owed by a company through a formal loan agreement.

choices.itemBody: A. financial liabilities owed by a company through a formal loan agreement.
B. amounts a company owes its vendors for purchase of goods and services.
C. reported in a different section of the balance sheet from notes payable due in one year.

entry.title: ITEM_20170608365
entry.itemBody: Under International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS), reported operating cash flows can be increased by the classification choice made for:

answerFeedback.08c48914-3dfc-4194-859a-383c36957fde: Incorrect. IFRS allows classification of dividends paid as either an operating or a financing cash flow. However, when dividends paid is shown as an operating cash flow, reported operating cash flows are decreased (not increased). However, if it is classified as financing cash flows, it would not impact operating cash flows.
answerFeedback.18e106d4-2bee-4d5f-8caf-c05edbafc774: Incorrect. The impairment loss is a non-cash item and will not affect cash from operations.
answerFeedback.7b4f6869-fc3f-461b-9962-941fd2f23564: Correct. IFRS allows the classification of interest received as either an operating or a investing cash flow. When interest received is classified as operating cash flows, it would increase the reported operating cash flows. However, if it is classified as investing cash flows, it would not impact operating cash flows.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2021.09-FRA-Mazararu-17
entry.itemBody: A construction company enters into a 2-year building contract. Payment of the consideration will be at the end of the building contract when all performance obligations are met. Costs incurred provide an appropriate measure of progress towards completing the contract. The construction company has incurred 30% of the costs during the first year. Assuming it is highly probable that revenue will not be subsequently reversed, at the end of Year 1, the construction company should most likely recognize a:

answerFeedback.48e0e349-9e75-4d63-9299-5a16dba6134f: Incorrect because when revenue is recognized, a contract asset is presented on the balance sheet. It is only at the point when all performance obligations have been met except for payment that a receivable appears on the seller’s balance sheet.
answerFeedback.ba85c06c-f142-4ad1-a732-169b987bb414: Correct because when revenue is recognized, a contract asset is presented on the balance sheet. It is only at the point when all performance obligations have been met except for payment that a receivable appears on the seller’s balance sheet.
answerFeedback.ecace6c4-b7f0-4f0e-bcd3-8aebe530c31e: Incorrect because when revenue is recognized, a contract asset is presented on the balance sheet. It is only at the point when all performance obligations have been met except for payment that a receivable appears on the seller’s balance sheet. If consideration is received in advance of transferring good(s) or service(s), the seller presents a contract liability.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2022.01-Quant-Lamba-03
entry.itemBody: A company will lease machinery for five years with lease payments of $6,000 to be made at the end of each quarter, with the first payment due in three months. If the interest rate is 6% per year compounded quarterly, the present value of the lease payments is closest to:

answerFeedback.1e409f1d-7858-433c-ae25-dfa3edfc632d: Incorrect because here the lease payments are assumed to be annual (= $6,000 × 4 = $24,000) and are then discounted at 6% per year over a 5-year period to give: PV = $24,000{[1 – 1/(1 + 0.06)5]/0.06} = $101,096.73 ≈ $101,097
answerFeedback.883345c7-36b4-4efd-8b37-f04ad4bc952b: Correct because an ordinary annuity has equal annuity payments, with the first payment starting one period into the future. In total, the annuity makes N payments, with the first payment at t = 1 and the last at t = N. We can express the present value of an ordinary annuity as the sum of the present values of each individual annuity payment. Here, the number of quarterly lease payments is 5 × 4 = 20 and the interest rate is 6%/4 = 1.5% per quarter, implying a present value PV = $6,000{[1 – 1/(1 + 0.015)20]/0.015} = $103,011.83 ≈ $103,012.
answerFeedback.9cd9717a-fd02-4504-8b1e-5d454e6cdff3: Incorrect because, as stated in the stem, the first payment starts at the end of the first quarter. Response C - $104,5557 – is calculated by incorrectly assuming the payments start immediately, not one period into the future.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2021.09-FRA-Terry-13
entry.itemBody: Which of the following most likely enforces financial reporting requirements?

answerFeedback.8152f49f-e7cc-4063-85b2-7f08fa8f224c: Correct because regulatory authorities require publicly traded issuers to prepare financial reports in accordance with specified accounting standards and other securities laws and regulations. Although technically not a regulatory authority, IOSCO regulates a significant portion of the world’s financial capital markets. To ensure consistent application of international financial standards (such as the Basel Committee on Banking Supervision’s standards and IFRS), it is important to have uniform regulation and enforcement across national boundaries.
answerFeedback.ab10ea5f-286d-43f0-ad5e-58758692e67e: Incorrect because regulatory authorities require publicly traded issuers to prepare financial reports in accordance with specified accounting standards and other securities laws and regulations.
answerFeedback.d52208df-2abc-439d-8d80-a21f98a75534: Incorrect because regulatory authorities require publicly traded issuers to prepare financial reports in accordance with specified accounting standards and other securities laws and regulations.

choices.itemBody: C. Both regulatory authorities and standard-setting bodies

entry.title: ITEM_20170531047
entry.itemBody:
The following data apply to a firm operating in perfect competition.
Quantity Total Revenue Total Cost
21 $210 $138
22 $220 $145
23 $230 $154
24 $240 $165

The firm’s profit maximizing output (in units) is most likely:

answerFeedback.2f935ed0-511d-44ca-9812-2a1d12b22e08: Correct because under perfect competition, economic profits are maximized when marginal revenue equals short-run marginal cost—in this case, marginal cost crosses $10 per unit. Profits are maximized at 23 units of production because marginal cost is in excess of marginal revenue at 24 units.
answerFeedback.5afb7594-5017-4bde-876b-2c2a1b26c00e: Incorrect because higher quantities deliver marginal revenue above marginal cost.
answerFeedback.c1500ec2-f0ff-4816-8cb7-7370694a7a8c: Incorrect because at 24 units, marginal costs exceed marginal revenue.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-L1-2020B-Econ-Erickson-03
entry.itemBody: A central bank is least likely to:

answerFeedback.a1cb5f75-6f39-4777-a1f8-47fffbe8d941: Incorrect because most central banks will also be responsible for managing their country’s foreign currency reserves and also its gold reserves.
answerFeedback.a7498a8a-b125-4d59-8aee-3cc6d389223e: Incorrect because perhaps the least appreciated role of a central bank is its role in the payments system. Central banks are usually asked to oversee, regulate, and set standards for a country’s payments system.
answerFeedback.c5471d27-64dd-4552-b429-6fee8efeabef: Correct because while central banks are usually responsible for the operation of a country’s monetary policy, they are not responsible for setting or implementing fiscal policy. Monetary policy refers to central bank activities that are directed toward influencing the quantity of money and credit in an economy. By contrast, fiscal policy refers to the government’s decisions about taxation and spending.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-L1-09602
entry.itemBody: The possibility of new entrants into an industry is considered in the calculation of:

answerFeedback.4f04c3ac-7685-4b90-857c-b9605ebcd747: Correct because just like the concentration ratio, the HHI does not take the possibility of entry into account.
answerFeedback.639a1ea8-09c3-4851-aab0-bdaff65eebc5: Incorrect because just like the concentration ratio, the HHI does not take the possibility of entry into account.
answerFeedback.ddc3ba02-f59f-447d-9f39-fc94ad03e9fd: Incorrect because just like the concentration ratio, the HHI does not take the possibility of entry into account.

choices.itemBody: C. neither the concentration ratio nor the Herfindahl–Hirschman index.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2023.01-CorpIssuers-Erickson-06
entry.itemBody: Private companies most likely have:

answerFeedback.56b1c662-881e-4a1d-a5e6-96d7631b483e: Correct because in contrast to public companies, the shares of a private company are not listed (do not trade on an exchange), so no visible company valuation or share price transparency exists.
answerFeedback.843fcca6-a661-4538-90ef-6a20ad30a0a3: Incorrect because private companies typically have less share price transparency than public companies.
answerFeedback.a4dc0703-1015-4b8e-925d-6c0b66f81eb1: Incorrect because private companies typically have less share price transparency than public companies.

choices.itemBody: A. less share price transparency compared to public companies.
B. similar share price transparency as public companies.
C. greater share price transparency compared to public companies.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2022.06-FSAN-Mazararu-04
entry.itemBody:
An analyst gathers the following information (in € thousands) about a company:

Purchases from suppliers 9,000
Increase in inventory 1,000
Increase in accounts payable 1,500

Cash paid to suppliers (in € thousands) is:

answerFeedback.3b73c71d-9572-42b5-84dd-f88aadff4be7: Incorrect because the Increase in inventory is added to and the Increase in accounts payable is deducted from Purchases from suppliers (instead of cost of sales) to determine cash paid to suppliers, as follows: Cash paid to suppliers = Purchases from suppliers + Increase in inventory –  Increase in accounts payable = 9,000 + 1,000 – 1,500 = 8,500.
answerFeedback.780c76ae-04dc-408f-aa2f-2712ce037306: Incorrect because it determines the cost of sales (instead of cash paid to suppliers) as Purchases from suppliers – Increase in inventory = 9,000 – 1,000 = 8,000.
answerFeedback.809301a9-fe31-4c81-a1a0-1bc74d860e27: Correct because cash paid to suppliers can be calculated by adjusting purchases for the change in accounts payable. Accordingly, Cash paid to suppliers = Purchases from suppliers – Increase in accounts payable = 9,000 – 1,500 = 7,500.

entry.title: ITEM_20170421049
entry.itemBody:
An analyst gathers the following information about the incremental after-tax cash flows (in $ millions) for three independent investments:
  Year 0 Year 1 Year 2 Year 3 Year 4 Year 5
Investment 1 −80 0 0 60 60 ---
Investment 2 −125 35 60 80 −20 ---
Investment 3 −100 11 11 11 11 11 into perpetuity

If the required rate of return (r) is 12%, a company should most likely undertake which investment(s)?

answerFeedback.71bb1019-6d65-432c-be00-c74bcaabc697:
Correct because the NPV is calculated as follows:

NPV = ∑ t = 0 N CF t ( 1 + r ) t

where required return (r) is 12 percent

Investment 1: NPV1 = − 80 + 0 ( 1.12 ) 1 + 0 ( 1.12 ) 2 + 60 ( 1.12 ) 3 + 60 ( 1.12 ) 4

= $0.84

Investment 2: NPV2 = − 125 + 35 ( 1.12 ) 1 + 60 ( 1.12 ) 2 + 80 ( 1.12 ) 3 + − 20 ( 1.12 ) 4

= −$1.69

Investment 3: NPV3 = − 100 + 11 0.12

= −$8.33, where the present value of a perpetuity is C F ¯ / r with C F ¯ being the annual cash flow and r the discount rate

At a required rate of return of 12 percent, investment 1 is the only investment with positive NPV.
answerFeedback.8e468a44-444d-48db-bd50-67006ffc87bf: Incorrect because both investments 2 and 3 have negative NPVs and should be rejected.
answerFeedback.ff67673f-4119-4579-b377-b7bb3ddde6dc: Incorrect because Investment 2 has a negative NPV and should be rejected.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2021.09-FRA-Terry-04
entry.itemBody: A company spends €10 million on start-up costs that are expensed for accounting purposes and fully amortized over five years using the straight-line method for tax purposes. If the start-up costs will result in future economic benefits, the tax base at the end of Year 1 is:

answerFeedback.6d238aca-9972-4d17-8bf5-0355dcc02e0c: Incorrect because this is the carrying amount. The full amount has been expensed for financial reporting purposes leaving a carrying amount of 0.
answerFeedback.8a4cc71d-e143-4749-9e24-9ca6c04070b7: Correct because using the straight-line method, the company will deduct 1/5 for the taxes in Year 1 = 10 / 5 = 2, leaving a balance of 10 – 2 = 8. The tax base of an asset or liability is the amount at which the asset or liability is valued for tax purposes, whereas the carrying amount is the amount at which the asset or liability is recorded in the financial statements.
answerFeedback.bfb5ad6f-1c7f-40bf-ba19-c476cdf708b4: Incorrect because this is the total amount of the expense. This would be correct only if the company was not able to amortize the expenses over time for tax purposes and they had expected future economic benefits.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2022.01-Quant-Chua-09
entry.itemBody: Which of the following lists of terms is ordered from thinner to fatter tails compared with a normal distribution?

answerFeedback.2fa0b74b-accb-4713-bbfb-613c8adab434: Correct because a distribution that has fatter tails than the normal distribution is referred to as leptokurtic or fat-tailed; a distribution that has thinner tails than the normal distribution is referred to as being platykurtic or thin-tailed; and a distribution similar to the normal distribution as concerns relative weight in the tails is called mesokurtic.
answerFeedback.c4030124-1623-4075-8b7b-926616382f61: Incorrect because a distribution that has fatter tails than the normal distribution is referred to as leptokurtic or fat-tailed; a distribution that has thinner tails than the normal distribution is referred to as being platykurtic or thin-tailed; and a distribution similar to the normal distribution as concerns relative weight in the tails is called mesokurtic.
answerFeedback.d352ab8c-66a7-4bc3-92d1-e678ca5488cf: Incorrect because a distribution that has fatter tails than the normal distribution is referred to as leptokurtic or fat-tailed; a distribution that has thinner tails than the normal distribution is referred to as being platykurtic or thin-tailed; and a distribution similar to the normal distribution as concerns relative weight in the tails is called mesokurtic.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2022.01-Econ-Chua-03
entry.itemBody: The archetype of country behavior most likely characterized by globalization and cooperation is:

answerFeedback.8904c3d8-c8e8-408d-aeb0-d186e6e9a3a4: Incorrect because bilateralism is characterized by nationalism/anti-globalization and cooperation.
answerFeedback.9baa0810-f03b-4305-9150-1e09d2ef5232: Correct because multilateralism is characterized by globalization and cooperation.
answerFeedback.af75175e-d3fc-4111-b187-82ed983572e5: Incorrect because hegemony is characterized by globalization and non-cooperation.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2023.01-FSAN-Huffman-07
entry.itemBody: With respect to a Porter's five forces analysis, which of the following best describes government policies?

answerFeedback.94a13ae5-b53a-43d6-85ce-af1d17ecc123: Correct because the best way to understand the influence of government on competition is to analyze how specific government policies affect the five competitive forces.
answerFeedback.bb3cb7b5-d23e-4c75-b73b-c27c675e8308: Incorrect because government is not best understood as a sixth force because government involvement is neither inherently good nor bad for industry profitability.
answerFeedback.cd61f563-c9f9-478a-a3be-aaaeae11737f: Incorrect because the best way to understand the influence of government on competition is to analyze how specific government policies affect the five competitive forces, rather than ignoring government policies.

choices.itemBody: A. They are viewed as a sixth force
B. They are ignored because they affect all companies in the industry
C. They are analyzed to understand how they affect the five competitive forces

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-L1-04280
entry.itemBody:
An analyst gathers the following information (in $ millions) about a company:

Average total assets 50
Average total liabilities 30

The financial leverage ratio is:

answerFeedback.53caa877-8265-407d-9d54-5c2f6242ea6b: Incorrect because Financial leverage ratio = Average total liabilities / Average total assets; or = $30 / $50 = 0.6.
answerFeedback.6a0377f6-b0fb-40e1-85fc-2d19c17b9ce0: Correct because Financial leverage ratio = Average total assets / Average total equity. In addition, Average total assets = Average total equity + Average total liabilities; or Average total equity = $20. Accordingly, Financial leverage ratio = $50 / $20 = 2.5.
answerFeedback.e67e37a9-090c-486a-8a52-9de83d8bd755: Incorrect because Financial leverage ratio = Average total liabilities / Average total equity; or = $30 / $20 = 1.5.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2021.07-Econ-Tsependa-10
entry.itemBody: A primary aim of fiscal policy is to manage the economy through its influence on:

answerFeedback.0d07c33f-e44a-4031-ad7a-b1057acba7c3: Correct because a primary aim for fiscal policy is to help manage the economy through its influence on aggregate national output, that is, real GDP.
answerFeedback.d226c2f7-f937-4c2c-a78b-e4cb2ef2c05e: Incorrect because price stability is a goal of the monetary policy, not fiscal policy. While monetary policy may have different goals, there is one overarching objective that most seem to acknowledge explicitly, and that is the objective of maintaining price stability.
answerFeedback.e93ed247-8efe-4165-8903-9001c0a56393: Incorrect because it is monetary policy (not fiscal policy) that uses interest rate as a tool. The most obvious expression of a central bank’s intentions and views comes via the interest rate it sets. The name of the official interest rate (or official policy rate or just policy rate) varies from central bank to central bank, but its purpose is to influence short- and long-term interest rates and ultimately real economic activity.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-L1-2020-C2-CorpFin-Moustra-01
entry.itemBody:
An analyst gathers the following information about a company:

Before-tax cost of debt 5%
Marginal tax rate 30%
Cost of equity 8%
Target debt-to-equity ratio 50%

The company's WACC is equal to:

answerFeedback.3e6cddf0-ddc7-471f-80fd-6affacc2f249: Incorrect because this distractor incorrectly omits the tax rate. WACC ≠ (D/E)/[1 + (D/E)] × rd + 1/[1 + (D/E)] × re = 0.5/(1+0.5) × 0.05 + 1/(1 + 0.5) × 0.08 = 7.00%.
answerFeedback.72c4d091-98bb-41cf-b3e6-27923d8d97b1: Incorrect because this distractor incorrectly interprets the debt-to-equity ratio as 50% weight for debt and 50% weight for equity. WACC ≠ wdrd(1 – t) + wprp + were = 0.5 × 0.05 × (1 – 0.30) + 0.5 × 0.08 = 5.75%.
answerFeedback.a403b2b7-3086-45ae-83c6-7a0f12eceb28: Correct because WACC = wdrd(1 – t) + wprp + were . Given that there is no preferred stock in the capital structure, WACC = wdrd(1 – t) + were. Also, a simple way of transforming a debt-to-equity ratio D/E into a weight—that is, D/(D + E)—is to divide D/E by 1 + D/E. As a result, WACC = (D/E)/[1 + (D/E)] × rd × (1 – t) + 1/[1 + (D/E)] × re = 0.5/(1+0.5) × 0.05 × (1 – 0.30) + 1/(1 + 0.5) × 0.08 = 6.50%.

answerFeedback.4d794b86-8482-4b7e-9490-c19a10185f3e: Incorrect because when we look at the residuals of a model, what we would like to see is that the residuals are random. The residuals should not exhibit a pattern when plotted against the independent variable.
answerFeedback.a3ba592e-2a3d-4627-960f-794b08fb7ed5: Correct because when we look at the residuals of a model, what we would like to see is that the residuals are random. The residuals should not exhibit a pattern when plotted against the independent variable.
